metadata.title: CVE-2022-36021 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description: Redis is an in-memory database that persists on disk. Authenticated users can use string matching commands (like `SCAN` or `KEYS`) with a specially crafted pattern to trigger a denial-of-service attack on Redis, causing it to hang and consume 100% CPU time. The problem is fixed in Redis versions 6.0.18, 6.2.11, 7.0.9.

criterions.comment: redis package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
